translated: Birth Stories
The Nine-Part Collection
The Vulture Peak
The Birth Story of Lomasakassapa
“O King, the horse is like the moon,
completely ageless and immortal;
If you were to sacrifice,
the sage Lomasakassapa.”
“This great earth, with its ocean and earrings,
I do not desire with criticism,
know this to be better.
Shame on that gain of fame,
and gain of wealth, brahmin;
That livelihood by downfall,
or by conduct contrary to the Dhamma.
Even if one goes forth with a bowl,
as a homeless one wandering,
that livelihood is better,
than seeking by conduct contrary to the Dhamma.
Even if one goes forth with a bowl,
as a homeless one wandering,
not harming another in the world,
even by a rope, that is better.”
“Power is the moon, power is the sun,
power are the ascetics and brahmins;
Power is the ocean’s shore,
power is women, the most powerful.
Just as the risen sun,
the sage Lomasakassapa;
for the sake of his father, like the moon,
he performed the Vaja sacrifice.”
“That deed done out of greed,
Bitter is the fruit of sensual pleasures,
I will seek the root of it,
And cut off lust with all its bonds.
Fie on sensual pleasures, so many in the world,

analyzed: tapaḥ uva seyyaḥ kāma guṇehi rāja
translated: Better is the ascetic life than sensual pleasures, King;
I will practice asceticism, having abandoned sensual pleasures,

original: Taveva raṭṭhaṁ candavatī ca hotū”ti.🔽Lomasakassapajātakaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: tava iva raṭṭham candavatī ca hotu iti 🔽lomasakassapajātakam sattama
translated: May your kingdom be like the moon.”🔽The Birth Story of Lomasakassapa (Sutta 7) is finished.
